required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled Study on the Effects of LearningRx Brain Training for Improving Cognitive Skills in Students Ages 8-14

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine changes in multiple cognitive skills after completing 60 hours of cognitive training with ThinkRx, a LearningRx program.

detailed_description.textblock: In a two-phase randomized controlled study, investigators will examine the effects of a one-on-one cognitive training program on memory, visual and auditory processing, processing speed, reasoning, attention, and General Intellectual Ability (GIA) score for students ages 8-14. In Phase 1, participants will be randomly assigned to either an experimental group to complete 60 hours of one-on-one cognitive training or to a wait-list control group. In Phase 2, the wait-list control group will complete the intervention using an alternative delivery model: 50% clinician delivered and 50% digital delivery.

primary_outcome.measure: Evidence of overall cognitive function improvement
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Confirmed by pretest to post-test change on the Woodcock Johnson III - Tests of Cognitive Abilities (WJ III): General Intellectual Ability composite score

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in school performance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within two years after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by improvement in school achievement tests and grade reports

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in working memory
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by pretest to posttest change on the WJ III: Numbers Reversed test

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in long-term memory
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by pretest to posttest change on the WJ III: Visual-Auditory Learning Delayed test

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in fluid reasoning
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by pretest to posttest change on the WJ III: Concept Formation test

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in processing speed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by pretest to posttest change on the WJ III: Visual Matching test

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in visual processing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by pretest to posttest change on the WJ III: Spatial Relations test

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in auditory processing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by pretest to posttest change on the WJ III: Sound Blending test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by pretest to posttest change on the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Cognition Toolbox attention test

arm_group.description: The intervention is a 60-hour one-on-one cognitive training program
The treatment-as-usual control group will begin the intervention when the experimental arm has completed the intervention.

intervention.description: A clinician will deliver forty 90-minute cognitive training sessions over 12-14 weeks for a total of 60 training hours. There are 23 different categories of training procedures sequenced in intensity and difficulty for a total of more than 1000 training tasks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Between 8-14 years of age, living in the greater Colorado Springs area, screening GIA score between 70 and 130
Exclusion Criteria:

results_reference.citation: Carpenter DM, Ledbetter C, Moore AL. LearningRx Cognitive Training Effects in Children Ages 8-14: A Randomized Controlled Trial. Appl Cogn Psychol. 2016 Sep-Oct;30(5):815-826. Epub 2016 Aug 2.
